What is the total number of care homes in Penkridge?

There are 336 care homes in Penkridge catering to various elderly needs and offering different levels of care and support. These include Havenly Care, Wheaton Aston Care Home, Maple Lodge (Stafford).

In Penkridge, what types of care are available?

Care homes in Penkridge offer a wide range of services such as Home Care, Care Home, Housing with Care, Nursing Homes, Supported Living, Respite Care.

How many nursing homes are there in Penkridge?

8 nursing homes in Penkridge, including The Heathers Nursing Home and Dora Rose Care Home, offer dedicated nursing care to residents with complex health needs.

How many care homes in Penkridge provide residential care?

There are 336 care homes in Penkridge, but almost 23 of them focus on residential care for people who just need help with daily living. YourLife (Stafford) and Midlands Community Care Ltd, are some providers.

Are there any dementia care homes in Penkridge?

People with dementia can find many cares homes in Penkridge. There are also 26 facilities in the area that provide dementia care services, such as The Old Post Office Residential Home and Always Home Care, which offer specialised support and tailored environments that enhance the well-being of residents with dementia.

Does Penkridge have many respite care facilities?

Many care homes in Penkridge provide respite care as a vital service. There are 1 facilities such as Wheaton Aston Care Home, that offer short-term respite care, allowing caregivers to take a break whilst ensuring their loved ones receive appropriate care and attention.

Do any Penkridge care homes provide end-of-life or palliative care?

A number of care homes in Penkridge provide palliative or end-of-life care. In addition, approximately 1 facilities in the area, such as Wheaton Aston Care Home, specialise in providing compassionate and supportive care to individuals facing terminal illness or nearing the end of their lives.
